result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D. Altman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 12CF171

01:04 PM Defendant Matthew D. Altman not in court.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent Michael Pribnow appeared in court for the S/W DOC. Court and court reporter appeared via zoom. 12CF171 and 15CF87 heard at this time. ADA Walker requests an extension for payments, Defendant has not made an effort to make payments. Requests a dollar amount to be paid each month. Agent Pribnow addresses- MN DOC states Defendant has quit reporting and no longer lives at the address on file. Court: grants request and orders probation be extended for 2 years and Orders Def to pay at minimum of $100/month towards restitution. 1:08

Defendant will be able to make $200 payments per month. Extend probation for 2 years and court will review at that time.  15CF87 - court costs. Extend probation for 2 years also.  No civil judgment at this time.  Pribnow to prepare extensions.  3:08 p.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew D. Altman

11:22 a.m.  Defendant Matthew D. Altman in court with attorney Julie A. Weber.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 12CF171.  Thorie - PSI in 12CF171.  PSI only refers to 12CF171... guilty plea to 15CF87 asks court to consider PSI, 4 years probation.  Weber in agreement.    Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Count 1 in 15CF87.    Facts are correct.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.    The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Count 1 in 15CF87.  Sentencing on 15CF87 and 12CF171.  Thorie - 12CF171 -  probation rather than prison.  Restitution in the amount of $10,______________.  Conditions of PSI. No consumption of alcohol or drugs.   Conditional jail time.  Credit for time served if revoked.  8 month jail sentence as a condition of supervision.  Weber addresses the court regarding sentencing.  Consider 4 months to 6 months jail with Huber for school and child care, lesser probation time.  Altman addresses the court regarding sentencing.  12CF171 - Court orders S/W - 4 years probation, conditions of probation to be set by agent,    No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs.  No entry not bar, tavern or liquor store.  Not contact with victim.  DNA sample and surcharge of $250.00.  Restitution in the amount of $10, 257.14.  Conditional jail time, 8 months in Pierce County Jail with work release privileges for school, child care, mental health treatment and programming he is involved in.  Start no later than Friday April 1, 2016 at 7:00 p.m.  Court costs $515.00.  15CF86 - S/W - 4 years probation concurrent to 12CF171.  Conditions as set by agent.  Court costs $515.00.  Appeal rights are given.
Defendant's Notice of Hearing. re: Return to Sender. Attempted - Not Known. Unable to Forward.
to continue sentencing hearing on 12CF171 to allow it to be resolved with 15CF87 filed by Atty Weber
Plea hearing at 02-29-2016 11:00 am.

9:12 Defendant Matthew D. Altman in court with attorney Julie A. Weber.  Defendant Matthew D. Altman in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF87 heard at this time. Motion to Reinstate Bond filed by Atty Weber. Atty Weber requests bond be reinstated in 12CF171 and a signature bond or lower cash bond on 15CF87. Thorie responds and willingly does not oppose to reinstate the bond on 12CF171 or a signature bond in 15CF87. Court reinstates signature bond in 12CF171 and converts it to a $5,000 signature bond.

Judge exams the defendant re the waiver of preliminary hearing.
